p: Similarly to other coronaviruses, SARS-CoV-2 could be associated with neurological complications. Such involvement has been observed in more severe cases and could be directly triggered by the virus itself or by the systemic consequences of the infection. Particularly, during elderly and in people with cardiac or endocrinological comorbidities, COVID-19 could manifest with fewer typical symptoms (namely flu-like symptoms), giving otherwise rise to more severe neurological manifestations. Hence, COVID-19 has to be suspected in the differential diagnosis of patients with neurological symptoms, especially in highly epidemic environments [ 11, 22, 25].
